data.description: A thief of 4th level or higher can read non-magical text in any language (including dead languages and basic codes) with 80% probability. If the roll does not succeed, the thief may not try to read that particular text again until they reach a higher level of experience.
data.name: Read Languages

data.description:
Requires thieves’ tools (see Adventuring Gear). A thief can only try this skill once per lock. If the roll fails, the thief may not try the same lock again before gaining an experience level.

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the successful result value; i.e. at 1st level, OL has “15”, therefore the Target value should be “15”.

Chance of Success
Level OL
1 15
2 20
3 25
4 30
5 35
6 45
7 55
8 65
9 75
10 85
11 95
12 96
13 97
14 99
data.name: Open locks (OL)

data.description: When attacking an unaware opponent from behind, a thief receives a +4 bonus to hit and doubles any damage dealt.
data.name: Back-stab

data.description:
A roll is required for each 100' to be climbed. If the roll fails, the thief falls at the halfway point, suffering falling damage.

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the successful result value; i.e. at 1st level, CS has “87”, therefore the Target value should be “87”.

Chance of Success
Level CS
1 87
2 88
3 89
4 90
5 91
6 92
7 93
8 94
9 95
10 96
11 97
12 98
13 99
14 99
data.name: Climb sheer surfaces (CS)

data.description:
If the victim is above 5th level, the thief’s roll is penalised by 5% for every level above 5th. There is always at least a 1% chance of failure. A roll of more than twice the percentage required for success means that the attempted theft is noticed. The referee should determine the reaction of the victim (possibly using the reaction table under Encounters).

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the successful result value; i.e. at 1st level, PP has “20”, therefore the Target value should be “20”.

Chance of Success
Level PP
1 20
2 25
3 30
4 35
5 40
6 45
7 55
8 65
9 75
10 85
11 95
12 105
13 115
14 125
data.name: Pick pockets (PP)

data.description: A thief can establish a thief den, attracting [[/r 2d6 # 1st Level Thief Apprentices]] apprentices of 1st level. These thieves will serve the character with some reliability; however, should any be arrested or killed, the PC will not be able to attract apprentices to replace them. A successful thief might use these followers to start a Thieves’ Guild.
data.name: After Reaching 9th Level

data.description: Because of their need for stealth and free movement, thieves cannot wear armour heavier than leather and cannot use shields. They can use any weapon.
data.name: Combat

data.description:
A roll is required to find a treasure trap and then another to remove it. This may be attempted only once per trap.

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the successful result value; i.e. at 1st level, TR has “10”, therefore the Target value should be “10”.

Chance of Success
Level TR

2 15
3 20
4 25
5 30
6 40
7 50
8 60
9 70
10 80
11 90
12 95
13 97
14 99
data.name: Find or remove treasure traps (TR)

data.description:
A thief may attempt to sneak past enemies unnoticed.

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the successful result value; i.e. at 1st level, MS has “20”, therefore the Target value should be “20”.

data.name: Move silently (MS)

data.description:
In a quiet environment (e.g. not in combat), a thief may attempt to listen at a door or to hear the sounds of something (e.g. a wandering monster) approaching.

FoundryVTT Note: Each time a  thief character is leveled, adjust the Target value to match the maximum value of the successful result range; i.e. at 1st level, HN has “1-2”, or a 2-in-6 chance of success, therefore the Target value should be “2”.

Chance of Success
Level HN
1 1–2
2 1–2

8 1–4

10 1–4

12 1–5

14 1–5
data.name: Hear Noise (HN)

data.description:
Requires the thief to be motionless—attacking or moving while hiding is not possible.

data.name: Hide in shadows (HS)

data.description: A thief of 10th level or higher can cast arcane spells from scrolls. There is a 10% chance of error: the spell does not function as expected and creates an unusual or deleterious effect.
data.name: Scroll Use

data.description:
Saving Throws
Level XP HD THAC0 D W P B S
1 0 1d4 19 [0] 13 14 13 16 15
2 1,200 2d4 19 [0] 13 14 13 16 15
3 2,400 3d4 19 [0] 13 14 13 16 15
4 4,800 4d4 19 [0] 13 14 13 16 15
5 9,600 5d4 17 [+2] 12 13 11 14 13
6 20,000 6d4 17 [+2] 12 13 11 14 13
7 40,000 7d4 17 [+2] 12 13 11 14 13
8 80,000 8d4 17 [+2] 12 13 11 14 13
9 160,000 9d4 14 [+5] 10 11 9 12 10
10 280,000 9d4+2* 14 [+5] 10 11 9 12 10
11 400,000 9d4+4* 14 [+5] 10 11 9 12 10
12 520,000 9d4+6* 14 [+5] 10 11 9 12 10
13 640,000 9d4+8* 12 [+7] 8 9 7 10 8
14 760,000 9d4+10* 12 [+7] 8 9 7 10 8

* Modifiers from CON no longer apply.

D: Death / poison; W: Wands; P: Paralysis / petrify; B: Breath attacks; S: Spells / rods / staves.
data.name: Thief Level Progression
